page.title: 11EDUCATION
page.content: St Michaels CofE Aided School with a head and 5 teachers provides free schooling for some 135 5-11 year olds. Built in the 1960s with Infant and Junior Blocks, craft room and sports field. Lunch is cooked in the kitchen. PCC, LEA and Parish Council provide governors. St Johns School at Marl- borough takes 130 older pupils upto 6th Form who travel in daily by bus. Some leave at 16 and follow vocational courses at the College, Swindon. About 2 enter university each year. Some 15 children go to fee paying schools elsewhere. A Playgroup of 30 children under 5 meets each morning with 2 supervisors, 2 assistants and 1 from the mothers rota. Adult classes during the winter include slimnastics and upholstery. The WEA with Bristol Uni- versity provides evening classes in literature and archaeology
